definition: letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: Exam, only write the pen of the broken broken voice and more or less beating.
sentences.chinese: 考试中，只有写字笔的碎碎声音和或多或少的心跳声。

sentences.english: Atoms must start with a lower case character, or you can delimit with single quotes.
sentences.chinese: 原子值必须以小写字母开头，否则需要加上单引号。

sentences.english: Her initials were enchased on the monument.
sentences.chinese: 她的名字缩写字母刻在纪念碑上。

sentences.english: I want to write on the blackboard, so I have to wipe all the words here out.
sentences.chinese: 我想在黑板上写字，所以我必须把上面的单词都擦去。

sentences.english: He finally rummaged out her reply in the middle drawer of his desk.
sentences.chinese: 他最后从写字台中间抽屉里翻找出她的复信。

sentences.english: The character which when preceded by an escape character represents any non-upper case character.
sentences.chinese: 前跟转义字符用于表示任意非大写字母的字符。

sentences.english: Assignment activities used for setup begin with a lowercase letter.
sentences.chinese: 用于设置的分配活动则以小写字母开头。

sentences.english: He left it on my desk yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 他昨天放在我的写字台上了。

sentences.english: It's important the table and column are in uppercase, or the query will not work.
sentences.chinese: 表和列都要用大写字母，这很重要，否则查询将无效。

sentences.english: Your posture of reading and writing must be proper, or you will get spondylopathy.
sentences.chinese: 看书写字的姿势一定要端正，否则容易得脊椎病。

sentences.english: They claimed that Harrison could not read or write.
sentences.chinese: 他们声称哈里森不会读书，不会写字。

sentences.english: Please complete in BLACK INK using BLOCK CAPITALS, providing as much information as possible.
sentences.chinese: 请用黑色墨水笔填写，要求全部用大写字母。

sentences.english: It would seem that there's a hidden room in the scriptorium.
sentences.chinese: 似乎在写字间里，还隐藏着一个房间。

sentences.english: You can see the inner ring, have called each other inside the office of the Chinese?
sentences.chinese: 你看内环之内，有没有写字楼里面互相称呼中文名的？

definition: to practice calligraphy from a model
generic term for hard writing instruments such as quill pens, fountain pens, ball pens and pencils, as opposed to writing brushes
piece of paper with short note/short letter
to write without lifting one's pen from the paper
to trace over red characters (as a method of learning to write)
to play or strum a lute or other stringed instrument
to read a book/to study/to attend school
